donorname: John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation
projecttitle: to create an ecosystem for faster adoption of decentralized renewable energy technologies for climate-smart agriculture in eastern India.
project_descrip: Short: TO CREATE AN ECOSYSTEM FOR FASTER ADOPTION OF DECENTRALIZED RENEWABLE ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES FOR CLIMATE-SMART AGRICULTURE IN EASTERN INDIA. Long: to create an ecosystem for faster adoption of decentralized renewable energy technologies for climate-smart agriculture in eastern India.. Description: Environment Conservation Foundation (SwitchON) is a leading nonprofit institution in eastern India that works with rural communities to achieve equitable and sustainable development. Since 2008, it has simultaneously promoted sustainable livelihoods and addressed environmental challenges. SwitchOn works with state agencies and private sector actors to augment the use of clean energy, leveraging its relationships and learnings from field interventions. This award enables SwitchON to increase the incomes of smallholder farmers in the states of Jharkhand, Odisha and West Bengal, and simultaneously mitigate energy emissions from agricultural activities. The award supports SwitchON to develop an ecosystem for rapid scale-up of solar irrigation technology and to promote climate-smart agricultural practices in the three target states. It assists SwitchON to conduct evidence-based research in existing field sites where it has already enabled a switch from diesel-powered irrigation to solar technology.
shortdescription: TO CREATE AN ECOSYSTEM FOR FASTER ADOPTION OF DECENTRALIZED RENEWABLE ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES FOR CLIMATE-SMART AGRICULTURE IN EASTERN INDIA.
